title: Massimo Bonanni
text:
Massimo Bonanni (born 10 June 1982) is an Italian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> coach and a former player who played as a <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>.
Football career.
Bonanni started his career at <a href="A.S.%20Roma">A.S. Roma</a> youth system. He spent on loan to <a href="A.S.%20Viterbese%20Calcio">Viterbese</a>, <a href="Panachaiki">Panachaiki</a> and <a href="Vicenza%20Calcio">Vicenza</a>.
<a href="Vicenza%20Calcio">Vicenza</a> bought half of the player registration rights for €200,000 after a season long loan.
On 27 June 2005, he was bought back by Roma, for €500,000, and sold to <a href="U.S.%20Citt%C3%A0%20di%20Palermo">Palermo</a> on 1 July 2005, for €750,000 (the fee of signing <a href="Cesare%20Bovo">Cesare Bovo</a> on loan).
He made his Serie A debut against <a href="Parma%20F.C.">Parma F.C.</a> on 28 August 2005. He played 4 games in UEFA Cup and 18 in Serie A before on loan to <a href="S.S.%20Lazio">S.S. Lazio</a> on 31 January 2006. <a href="U.C.%20Sampdoria">U.C. Sampdoria</a> acquired half of the player registration rights on 14 July 2006, for €2 million, along with <a href="Christian%20Terlizzi">Christian Terlizzi</a> (50% for €1.5 million), as part of the <a href="Aimo%20Diana">Aimo Diana</a>'s transfer (€5 million).
He played 7 games in Serie A and 4 in Coppa Italia for Sampdoria, before loaned to <a href="Ascoli%20Calcio%201898">Ascoli</a> on 12 January 2007.
On 17 August 2007, Bonanni is on a one-year loan to <a href="A.S.%20Bari">Bari</a> of Serie B. He returned to Genoa, but after played once in 2008–09 season, he left for <a href="U.S.%20Grosseto%20F.C.">Grosseto</a> of Serie B. In June 2009 Palermo gave up the remain 50% registration rights to Sampdoria
On 31 July 2009, he signed a three-year contract with <a href="Pescara%20Calcio">Pescara</a> of <a href="Lega%20Pro%20Prima%20Divisione">Prima Divisione</a> for free.
On 12 July 2011, he signed a two-year contract with <a href="Swiss%20Challenge%20League">Swiss Challenge League</a> side <a href="FC%20Lugano">FC Lugano</a> on free transfer.
On 6 April 2012, he returned to Italy for Lugano's sister club <a href="Genoa%20C.F.C.">Genoa</a> (effective on 1 July 2012), however the sole purpose was transferred €1.45 million "transfer fee" to Lugano. He left for Serie B club <a href="U.S.%20Grosseto%20F.C.">U.S. Grosseto F.C.</a> on 31 August 2012 but returned to Switzerland on 9 January 2013, in temporary deal from Genoa.
